title: Web/documentation needs refresh
body: Milagro, in all aspects, needs a refresh. The project website and documentation sites are both horribly out of date. For the proposal, go to https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MILAGRO/Home

title: NA
body: Was issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MILAGRO-27 in Apache Jira (this issue will be closed presently)

title: NA
body: Let's close issue.

title: No link to issue tracker on website
body:
I could not find a link to the issue tracker on the website.

I'm hoping this is it...

Please ensure that it is easy to find the issue tracker from the website

title: NA
NA
body: Might be an idea to add a link to the Support page as well.

title: NA
body: @sebbASF - I've updated the support page to include an "issues" section - please can you confirm this is OK, and I'll close this?

title: NA
body:
It would be nice if the user did not have to click so many times to get to the issue tracker.

Currently the route from the main page is:
- click "Support"
- read the Issues para, and click "Contributing"
- scan the "Issues" para and click the appropriate link
- click the Issues tab

Obviously it's not possible to have a one-click link, as there are several issue trackers, but some of the stages could be eliminated.

One can go straight to "Contributing" from the main page, but if I am looking to report a bug, I would normally expect to find the instructions under "Support" rather than "Contributing"

Might be nice to have direct link to issues section on front page
Also could link directly to issues tab on Contributing page.

Another possibility would be to have a separate Issue handling page.
This could be linked from Support, Contributing and the Home page.

title: NA
body: Hi @sebbASF  - I've updated the support page with direct links to each repo's issue page

title: NA
body: Thanks, makes it easier to find the trackers

title: Mangled sentence
body:
The page http://milagro.apache.org/docs/milagro-intro/ has the following sentence:

"In certain use cases, this removes the need for a PKI infrastructure eliminates the root key 'single point of compromise' weakness, as the main reason to issue certificates is used to bind a public / private key pair to an identity."

This does not read well - maybe some missing words?
Probably should be split into multiple sentences.

title: NA
body: @sebbASF - we've addressed this issue - please let me know if it's OK?

title: NA
body:
It's better, but still a bit hard to read.

The following phrase:

"the need for a PKI infrastructure as the main reason to issue certificates"

would read better as

"the need for a PKI infrastructure, since the main reason to issue certificates"

As it stands, the "as" clause is ambiguous.
It could be taken in the sense of "Using another system as a backup".
The word "since" does not have that double meaning, and the comma helps too.

title: NA
body: @sebbASF - this is now done - please can you confirm?

title: NA
body:
That reads better, thanks.

Just notice that the first sentence says:

"Apache Milagro is core security infrastructure and crypto libraries"

I suspect that should be something like:

"Apache Milagro is a set of core security infrastructure and crypto libraries

title: NA
body: @sebbASF - done.  Please can you confirm and I'll close this issue?

title: NA
body: Reads much better, thanks

title: Update build instructions for crypto-c/js & dta to build from source releases
body:
Currently the documentation for these three repos describes how to build by cloning the repos.  They should be updated to build from the official Apache source release archives.

Note that the installation instructions in each repo's readme files should remain unchanged.

title: NA
body: This has been addressed in the crypto-c library's next release (2.0.0).  The JS library will be addressed in its next release.

title: Milagro Java?
body:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-milagro-java

has been archived with no notice on why it is archived or where the current project can be found. 

The project is still registered on maven, but points to a removed repository in the milagro foundation:

https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.miracl.milagro.amcl/milagro-crypto-java/0.4.0/jar

Is the java project terminated?

title: Where is Milagro Golang now
body:
In the previous archived repos https://github.com/apache/incubator-milagro-crypto/tree/master/version3/go
I see there are golang implementation there. 
Where is it migrated to now?

title: Update website dependencies
body: The current website includes on several out of date dependencies. These need to be updated and the corresponding website rebuilt.

title: Documentation: quick start examples
body: Quick start examples are a great way for people to start playing around with our libraries. We should have them written for our core libraries and have them on our homepage.

title: Update the contributor guide
body: The current contributor guide (https://milagro.apache.org/docs/contributor-guide/) is out of date and needs to be updated with the new repositories, archiving the old ones.

title: IN20: Contributors act as themselves, not as representatives of a corporation or organization.
body:
This is a placeholder ticket to document everything that needs to happen to satisfy this benchmark and discuss it further.

We do want to be open to corporate involvement, but contributors should act as themselves. One way to do so is to subscribe to the communication channels using personal or apache-provided e-mail addresses, to ensure people can keep contributing outside of their professional involvement. This should probably be a policy at least for committers.

title: CS30-CS40: The project uses documented voting rules to build consensus when discussion is not sufficient
body:
Document our voting process (see: https://www.apache.org/foundation/voting.html)

CS-40 It's important to spell out that In Apache projects, vetoes are only valid for code commits. The person exercising the veto must justify it with a technical explanation, as per the Apache voting rules defined in CS30.

title: CS10 The project maintains a public list of its contributors who have decision power. The project's PMC (Project Management Committee) consists of those contributors.
body:
The current list is maintained at Whimsy. Other pages/files that need updating:

- [ ] https://incubator.apache.org/projects/milagro.html
- [ ] https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/public/trunk/content/podlings/milagro.yml
- [ ] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MILAGRO/Committers

This is the list of the places I have found - so far -. If you know about more places, please add them here
